common

Interface IChatServer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AChatServer, ChatAppModel.ProxyIChatServer, ChatRoomModel.ProxyIChatServer, ChatServer

    public interface IChatServer
extends java.rmi.Remote
    IChatServer interface is associated with a particular chatroom and used to receive the message targeted directly to the chatroom.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String BOUND_NAME
      The name the IUser object will be bound to in the RMI Registry
      static int BOUND_PORT
      The port that the chatroom will use to communicate with the IChatServer object Note that this port must be opened of inbound traffic on the server machine

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IChatroom getChatroom()
      Get the chatroom that it associated with
      ADataPacketAlgoCmdGroupF<?> getNewCommand(java.lang.Class<?> requestClass)
      This method is used to communicate back to the sender so we can get the new command to deal with the unknown datapacket
      IUser getUser()
      Get the user associated with this chatserver
      boolean joinChatroom(IChatServer chatStub)
      Add an IChatServer stub into the IChatServer list of its chatroom
      boolean leaveChatroom(IChatServer chatStub)
      Remove an IChatServer stub from the IChatServer list of its chatroom
      void receive(ADataPacket message)
      Receive and process the message sent by the remote application
      void refresh()
      This method is used to refresh the friend list of a chatroom.
      void setDataPacketAlgo(DataPacketAlgo<java.lang.String,IChatServer> dataPacketAlgo)

      • joinChatroom

        boolean joinChatroom(IChatServer chatStub)
              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Add an IChatServer stub into the IChatServer list of its chatroom
        Parameters:
        chatStub - to be added into the IChatServer list of its chatroom
        Returns:
        True if chatStub does not belong to the chatroom and false if chatStub belongs to the chatroom.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • leaveChatroom

        boolean leaveChatroom(IChatServer chatStub)
               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Remove an IChatServer stub from the IChatServer list of its chatroom
        Parameters:
        chatStub - to be added into the IChatServer list of its chatroom
        Returns:
        True if chatStub is removed from the chatroom and false if the chatStub is not in chatroom.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • receive

        void receive(ADataPacket message)
      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Receive and process the message sent by the remote application
        Parameters:
        sender - - the user who sent the message
        message - - the data packet that they sent
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getNewCommand

        ADataPacketAlgoCmdGroupF<?> getNewCommand(java.lang.Class<?> requestClass)
                                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method is used to communicate back to the sender so we can get the new command to deal with the unknown datapacket
        Parameters:
        requestClass - - A data type needed to be process
        Returns:
        a new command to deal with the unknown datapacket

        Throws:

      • refresh

        void refresh()
      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method is used to refresh the friend list of a chatroom. But note that this method will seldom be used as all the refresh process are handled automatically after we add a user or remove a user
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
